programme.desc: In this intense action flick, Agent Hobbs promises Dom and his crew full pardons if they assemble in London to stop a criminal outfit led by a ruthless mastermind whose right-hand woman is Dom's former lover Letty, whom he believed to be dead.

programme.title: The Wolverine
programme.desc: Still mourning the death of Jean Grey, Wolverine travels to Japan after an old friend tells him that he can remove his immortality, but he soon gets caught up in a conspiracy involving the yakuza in this action-packed and explosive comic-book adventure.

programme.title: Geostorm
programme.desc: In this riveting sci-fi action film, two scientists race to avert a catastrophe when a series of climate-control satellites malfunction. They soon discover a conspiracy involving the satellites, which were designed to prevent natural disasters on Earth.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: This version of Frank Herbert's popular 1965 sci-fi novel is the first of a two-part adaptation. This story covers only the first half of the novel and features Paul Atreides, whose duke father, Leto, accepts the stewardship of a planet called Arrakis. Since it's the main source of a most coveted substance called the melange, the leadership of its mining industry has been contentious, which the heir of the House Atreides will soon find out.

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: While vacationing in Egypt, detective Hercule Poirot finds himself in the thick of a love triangle that goes awry. However, when a wealthy young woman winds up dead, it is up to Poirot to track down the killer before he or she can claim a new victim. Based on the novel of the same name by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.desc: A talk show about current events with the former host of 'Politically Incorrect.' This weekly late-night forum is a virtual clone of 'P.I.,' with some Maher stand-up and a similarly diverse lineup of informed panelists, but this being HBO, the language is a good deal more blunt. In addition to the roundtable discussions, the show also features topical interviews with in-studio and satellite guests.

programme.title: House of the Dragon
programme.desc: Princess Rhaenyra dives deep into the prophecies about House Targaryen.

programme.title: Child 44
programme.desc: In this taut thriller set in 1953 Soviet Russia, an exiled secret-police agent hunts a serial killer who targets young boys. His investigation later reveals an unsettling conspiracy, which pits him against the ruthless government officials behind it.

programme.title: Killer Elite
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, this rollicking thriller follows former special-ops agent Danny Bryce (Jason Statham) on an explosive quest through 1980s Europe as he attempts to save his mentor by eliminating a group of assassins.

programme.title: Arsenal
programme.desc: This tense action thriller centers on a construction-company owner who must rescue his brother, a petty crook, after he is abducted by a vicious mobster. He is aided in his quest by a police detective and longtime friend.

programme.title: Belfast
programme.desc: It is 1969 and 9-year-old Buddy finds his peaceful life disturbed as a national conflict is starting to brew in Northern Ireland: unionists and loyalists—mostly Protestants—want the country to remain within the United Kingdom, while nationalists and republicans—mostly Catholics—are campaigning for the country to join a united Ireland. As the tension between these two opposing forces escalates, he and his family must decide whether to stay, or move somewhere safe.

programme.title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher
programme.desc: A two-part profile of Elvis Presley begins with his early life in Mississippi; his first encounter with Sun Records' Sam Phillips; tours of the South; and his decision to sign with a national label after his manager, Col. Tom Parker, bought out his contract.

programme.title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher
programme.desc: Elvis returns home after his Army discharge, when he was still a huge star and making hit records, but faces a rapidly changing pop-music scene.

programme.title: Eagle Eye
programme.desc: Two strangers become pawns in a diabolical plot and must work together to discover what is really happening while trying to prove that they are not terrorists. Shia LaBeouf ("Disturbia") and Michelle Monaghan star in this taut suspense thriller. Michael Chiklis, Rosario Dawson, Billy Bob Thornton. Directed by D.J. Caruso.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp with the Detroit Lions
programme.desc: An all-access look at second-year coach Dan Campbell's Detroit Lions in 2022 preseason training, showcasing the team's young emerging stars, established veterans, free agent additions and highly-regarded rookie hopefuls. Produced by NFL Films.

programme.title: The Princess
programme.desc: Princess Diana's story is told exclusively through contemporaneous archive creating a bold and immersive narrative of her life and death. It also illuminates how the public's attitude to the monarchy was, and still is.

programme.title: Christina on the Coast
programme.desc: After Christina bumps into a friend who runs one of her favorite design stores, she signs on to help him remake his new home. Simultaneously, she's offered the chance to go out of her comfort zone on a new beachside project.

programme.title: Christina on the Coast
programme.desc: Christina's design partner James brings her a project from a musical family in Fullerton, CA. She then learns the house is full of memories and must tailor her design to underscore a homeowner's nostalgia.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.desc: Jess and Rich thought they had finally found their dream home but discovered mold, and their renovation dreams were dashed as their budget was used to remediate the mold. Today, the mold is gone but the couples' laundry list of renovations is lengthy and they now have a baby on the way. Jasmine has only four weeks before the baby is due to turn their house around, renovating their kitchen, dining room and giving them a much-needed nursery.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.sub-title: Can You Believe I'm Living Here?
programme.desc: Chris and Sara have a gutted living room and kitchen and no real plan on how to fix it.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.sub-title: Time to Hand It Over to the Pros
programme.desc: Ozzie and Lauren purchased a house with the dream of creating the family home they've always wanted with their two young girls. They both have demanding jobs but together they've taken on small projects like laying hardwood floors.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to be Project Manager Anymore
programme.desc: A couple set out to create their dream home, but their skill level ran out and they have a million projects they can't finish. Jasmine steps in to turn their half-finished kitchen, bathroom and backyard into spaces where the family can relax and connect.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.sub-title: Help! My Reno Has No Plan
programme.desc: A couple who attempted to renovate their dream home without a plan, professional help or free time is now stuck living at their in-laws's place. Jasmine comes to their aid as she delivers a cozy kitchen and living room fit for their family of five.

programme.title: Help! I Wrecked My House
programme.desc: A family finds the ideal fixer-upper, but renovation stops when their DIY projects reveal damages.

programme.title: Mountain Men

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Martha and Elli stand their ground in a dangerous encounter with a bull moose; Mike sets off for uncharted territory in search of much needed meat and fur; Tom resurrects a primitive recurve bow, putting his skills to the test; Jake is hot on the trail of a mating pair of mountain lions; Kidd and Harry try to warm up after their drenched river crossing.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Tom and Nancy create a masterpiece out of a raw wolf hide. Jake and his young dogs tangle with two mountain lion kittens. programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Jake carries his best dog off the mountain after a battle with a huge mountain lion; Mike flies to the end of the earth for the last round-up. Martha and Elli rescue a hunter stranded in sub-zero temperatures; and Josh exacts vengeance after wolves take out one of his bison.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Tom ventures into new territory for beaver, and sets a personal record; Jake puts his young dogs to the test, but one goes missing on the mountain; Kidd and Harry navigate a gauntlet of river ice on a mid-winter fishing expedition; Mike risks being left stranded as he struggles to pack out 500 pounds of feral cow meat; and Josh harvests a bison in preparation for a high stakes taste test with a local butcher.

programme.title: Mountain Men

programme.desc: In a struggling Pennsylvania coal town, where high-school football is king, the killing of a Mexican immigrant splits the community. When star players emerge as suspects, some locals engage in a coverup that is almost as shocking as the murder.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: Juan Joseph, who led his high school football team to multiple victories, is gunned down, so his community unites to bring his killer to justice.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: Conspiracy theories rock a small Texas town after a beloved high school football player mysteriously vanishes. Baffling clues and community pressure pit the local sheriff against a brash private investigator until some very unusual suspects emerge.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: A cold-blooded murderer takes the life of local football hero TK Kelly. The high school standout had carried the dreams of his small California city on his shoulders, but for someone close to TK, jealousy of the star was motivation enough to kill.

programme.title: Web of Lies
programme.desc: A young woman far away from home finds herself increasingly isolated from her friends and family by the man she loves. As his efforts to control her intensify, she comes to realize that he will stop at nothing to keep her by his side.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: The parents of a young South Carolina couple are terrified when they go missing in 2016. Detectives find a clue that leads to strange storage container in the middle of 95 acres. What's inside unlocks secrets of a monster hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: In 1970's Detroit, a senseless murder rocks the African-American neighborhood of the North End. Police think they've got the perpetrators and a jury agrees. But it will take 47 years for the truth to finally emerge and right history's wrongs.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: A first-time mom fights off a violent intruder on Mother's Day, but has the uneasy feeling that he'll be back.

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: College graduate Anita Wooldridge goes missing from her parents' home. Investigators must rely on quick thinking and cunning police work, as they race against the clock to find her before it's too late.

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: Donna Ferres takes a job working the overnight shift at a local convenience store to pay for college. But after a familiar face walks into the store one night, her routine shift takes a sick and twisted turn.

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: In 1979, a walk in the woods turns out to be a deadly mistake for single mom Marie Huckins. Twenty years later, her daughter Patricia follows in the same fateful footsteps.

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: On their way to Oregon, young lovebirds Kevin Thorpe and Laura Craig come face-to-face with evil on the mountainous, desolate back roads of Northern California.

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: Connie Hilton and her husband George leave Dallas and move to a rural enclave in East Texas. Life couldn't be more perfect. But one early September morning, their peaceful, easy-living country life is abruptly and brutally shattered for good.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When 17-year-old Macin Smith doesn't come home from school, his parents worry. A note hidden in his wallet leaves his family troubled. And police attempt to piece together the puzzle while his family vacillates between hope and despair.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: While on a Caribbean cruise, 23-year old Amy Bradley vanishes from her family's cabin and is never seen again. Over a decades-long struggle, her family embarks on countless grueling searches, stopping at nothing, they say, to find their beloved Amy.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When Sage Smith, a transgender teen in Charlottesville, Va., goes missing, police identify a suspect. But the investigation turns up evidence that forces detectives to look closer into Sage's inner circle to see if there are answers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old college sophomore Martin Roberts is a popular fraternity brother. Suddenly he goes missing. The only clue he leaves: a cryptic note. Baffling secrets emerge. But two years later, his family remains desperate to know what has happened to him.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A young woman moves to the U.S. for a new opportunity, but in a mere matter of weeks, she vanishes without a trace. Kidnapping survivor Elizabeth Smart joins in the search to find her in this mystery where the clues are sparse.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Intelligence busts a meth lab run by gang leader Marshall Carter, they uncover a re-homing scam in which children adopted from foreign countries are abandoned and then sold online. programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A family is shot dead in their home and the team goes in search of a drug dealer with a likely connection. Voight asks for the help of Vice Sgt. Sean McGrady, who has an old beef with Upton. When McGrady turns up dead during the investigation, the case takes an unlikely turn.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: In the wake of several gang-related child abductions, Intelligence must race against time to find a kidnapped boy. programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A congressman is found passed out in his hotel room with a dead girl. When Intelligence discovers the murder is linked to a sting and Burgess' boyfriend is working with the Feds, Burgess must choose between compromising her case or her boyfriend's case.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The death of a judge's daughter puts Intelligence on the track of a pill mill spreading into the suburbs of Chicago and the doctor enabling it. Meanwhile, Voight discovers who's been leaking information from the 21st.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: While trying to find the pimp, Intelligence stumbles on the women's shelter where he's scouting out girls. And Burgess moves the case forward with a series of confidential tips, but risks putting her informant in harm's way.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.

programme.title: Norman Lear: Just Another Version of You - American Masters
programme.sub-title: Norman Lear: Just Another Version of You
programme.desc: A profile of Norman Lear, the creative mastermind behind such influential sitcoms as "All in the Family," "The Jeffersons," "Maude" and "Good Times." The shows changed the TV landscape in the early 1970s by using humor to promote social change. In 1981, he expanded his effort to influence public opinion by founding People for the American Way, a liberal advocacy group. The documentary features footage from Lear's own archives as well as remarks from Lear, family, friends and colleagues.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
programme.desc: The enchantment continues in the second entry in the fantasy-adventure series about the boy wizard. This time, students at Hogwarts School are turning to stone, among them Harry's good friend Hermione. So it's up to him and fellow apprentice sorcerer Ron Weasley to get to the bottom of things.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
programme.desc: The wondrous and magical adventures of the teen wizard continue in the third film in the series. This time, Harry deals with the escape of a wizard who knew his parents and may be looking for a showdown with him. Fantastic special effects include a flying hippogriff and an enchanted whomping willow.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
programme.desc: The thrilling fourth installment of the series is the best one yet. Ralph Fiennes joins the cast as Lord Voldemort, who concocts a diabolical plan to trap Harry at the Triwizard Tournament.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: In this thrilling and action-packed entry, Harry enters his fifth year at Hogwarts and forms a group with his friends called "Dumbledore's Army" to defend themselves against the Dark Arts.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
programme.desc: The sixth installment of this wonderfully enchanting saga finds Harry Potter entering his sixth year at Hogwarts, while Voldemort prepares his followers for a battle intended to kill Harry and eradicate all non-pure-blooded wizards. Harry's survival rests in the hands of Dumbledore, who leads him on a perilous journey through Voldemort's childhood memories so he may understand the enemy he is destined to fight.

programme.desc: Ross entrusts Rachel with his pet monkey for a day; Barry has a surprise for Rachel. Barry: Mitchell Whitfield. Luisa: Megan Cavanagh. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Brisket, Voodoo, and Cannonball Run
programme.desc: The kids brainstorm ways to resolve a family feud when Meemaw refuses to give George Sr. her brisket recipe.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: George Sr. strikes a deal with Sheldon to tutor Georgie when poor grades threaten to keep him from playing football.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean and an Eskimo
programme.desc: When Sheldon moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope with his absence.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Demons, Sunday School, and Prime Numbers
programme.desc: A worried Mary sends Sheldon to Sunday school after she finds him playing Dungeons and Dragons with his friends Tam and Billy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon petitions Wil Wheaton to appear on the new Professor Proton show, Wil offers a role to Amy instead. Also, Penny gets angry when she thinks the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Bernadette won't go into labor, all her friends try different tactics to get things started. Also, Wolowitz confronts Bernadette after Amy accidentally reveals she's already chosen their son's name.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Americana tunefest set against the backdrop of the impending 1904 World's Fair in St. Louis, as a family learn their father's business is transferring him to New York City, and his four daughters argue that they don't want to move. Songs include "The Boy Next Door," "The Trolley Song" and "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas."

programme.title: The Harvey Girls
programme.desc: A group of refined waitresses for a chain of railroad-station restaurants in New Mexico are sent out to tame the wild and woolly West in the 19th century, but encounter some resistance in the form of a saloon owner, a corrupt judge and a local madam. Featuring the Oscar-winning song "On the Atcheson, Topeka and the Santa Fe."

programme.title: Rationing
programme.desc: Wartime rivalry between a storekeeper (Wallace Beery) and a postmistress (Marjorie Main) over ration stamps. Dorothy Morris, Donald Meek, Gloria Dickson. Mrs. Porter: Connie Gilchrist. Lance: Tommy Butten. No longer topical. Willis Goldbeck directed.

programme.title: Gentle Annie
programme.desc: A lawman (James Craig) goes after a gang that includes a mother (Marjorie Main) and her sons (Henry Morgan, Paul Langton). Donna Reed, Barton MacLane, Noah Beery Sr. From MacKinlay Kantor's novel.

programme.title: The African Queen
programme.desc: The earthy, drunken captain of a tramp steamer helps the prim and proper sister of a missionary escape Africa after her brother dies. Along the way the pair gets past their differences and fall in love, but must contend with a tenacious German gunboat in order to escape with their lives.

programme.title: The Maltese Falcon
programme.desc: A hard-boiled San Francisco private eye is hired to track down a stolen artifact, a priceless, jewel-laden statuette of a black bird, and his investigation leads him to become embroiled in a series of crosses and double-crosses that lead back to his recently murdered partner. A Best Picture nominee that features an Oscar-nominated screenplay written by the film's director, John Huston, who adapted Dashiell Hammett's classic detective novel.

programme.title: Across the Pacific
programme.desc: A disgraced ex-Army officer jumps a Japanese steamer bound for the Panama Canal Zone in 1941, and along the way he uncovers intrigue about the Japanese and their plans for the Canal Zone.

programme.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is a treatise on greed and what "gold does to men's souls" when three miners, circa 1920s, set out to find the precious mineral in the mountains of Mexico. Oscars went to John Huston for Screenplay and Direction, and his father, Walter Huston, who won Best Supporting Actor for his performance as an old prospector.

programme.title: Key Largo
programme.desc: An adaptation of the Maxwell Anderson play about a war-weary World War II vet forced into a confrontation with the nervous, sadistic mobster who is holding the occupants of a Florida hotel hostage during a hurricane. Claire Trevor won a Supporting Actress Oscar as the gangster's drunken moll.

programme.title: To Have and Have Not
programme.desc: In World War II Martinique, a charter-boat owner agrees to a smuggling deal in an effort to help an attractive pickpocket get back to America. Later, when his first mate is taken hostage and pumped for information, the skipper must come to his rescue.

programme.title: The Big Sleep
programme.desc: A private eye is hired by a wealthy general with two daughters, one dangerously wild, one sly and observant. As the events unfold, a blackmail and extortion case turns into a murder investigation, and the PI must figure out who is playing him and why.

programme.title: Dark Passage
programme.desc: Film-noir thriller about a husband, falsely imprisoned for the murder of his wife, who escapes from jail to track down the actual murderer, but first must hide out in a woman's apartment while he recovers from plastic surgery on his face.

programme.title: The Corn Is Green
programme.desc: An ambitious teacher opens a school in a poor Welsh mining town and butts heads with the mine owners, but eventually she discovers a prize student who, after a couple of years, tries to get into an elite university.

programme.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
programme.desc: Best Actor Robert Donat stars as the title character, a beloved schoolmaster at a British boarding school, who initially starts out as a reticent sourpuss, but over the course of 63 years of teaching evolves into a venerable academic institution. Told in flashback, the Best Picture nominee is adapted from the James Hilton best seller. The film debut of Greer Garson (Best Actress nominee), who plays Mr. Chips' engaging young bride.

programme.title: Blackboard Jungle
programme.desc: An early film study of teens gone wild chronicles the efforts of an idealistic and dedicated teacher trying to cope with his classroom full of incorrigibles, including knife-wielding punks, in an urban high school. The film launched Bill Haley & the Comets' rock-and-roll anthem "Rock Around the Clock."

programme.title: Bright Road
programme.desc: A dedicated schoolteacher and an understanding principal in help a rebellious student overcome his circumstances and his pride in order to fulfill his potential.

programme.title: Zéro de conduite
programme.desc: In a repressive boarding school with rigid rules of behavior, four boys decide to rebel against the director on a celebration day.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: Judy Holliday is a delight in this farce about an unsuccessful model who believes her career needs a jolt of publicity, so she rents a billboard in Manhattan, emblazoned with her name on it, and sees the endorsements pour in as well as the suitors. Jack Lemmon made his screen debut as Holliday's "unofficial" boyfriend.

programme.title: The Fortune Cookie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous lawyer tries to win a hefty verdict after a cameraman is injured while filming a football game when a player runs into him. The attorney has his client exaggerate his injuries, which leads to the guilty-feeling football player waiting hand and foot on the client.

programme.title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
programme.desc: A suddenly unemployed executive and his wife must adapt to their new life.

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: As zombies continue to walk the Earth, a small band of civilians, scientists and trigger-happy soldiers hole up in an underground military bunker. Tensions rise among the survivors as the head scientist conducts macabre experiments on undead specimens. The third entry in George Romero's zombie series.

programme.title: I Was a Teenage Zombie
programme.desc: High-school teens kill a no-good drug dealer, who turns into a zombie with a taste for revenge. Low-budget chiller with lowbrow humor. Michael Rubin, Steve McCoy. John Elias Michalakis directed.

programme.title: The Golden Years
programme.desc: Innovations in the bowling world are featured.

programme.title: Gaslight
programme.desc: A newlywed is slowly driven to the brink of madness by her deceptively charming husband at their Victorian mansion in London. Ingrid Bergman won Best Actress as the wife, while Charles Boyer received a Best Actor nod as her spouse and Angela Lansbury, in her film debut (at age 18), was nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her role as a sassy cockney servant.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry
programme.desc: The maestro is conducting his orchestra of assorted animals. Some of them aren't particularly good at following his direction.

programme.title: How I Play Golf by Bobby Jones No. 7 the Spoon

programme.desc: Entry in the "Traveltalk" series visits Singapore and Jahore.

programme.desc: An undercover agent (Tom Keene) is sent to Texas to investigate cattle rustlers. Rochelle Hudson, Marie Wells, Julian Rivero, Hank Bell, Ernie Adams, Tom London.

programme.title: The Pool of Peril
programme.desc: Flash and his friends are captured by the rock men and must escape.

programme.title: Tarzan Triumphs
programme.desc: Tarzan (Johnny Weissmuller) goes to war when Nazis take over a jungle city. Boy: Johnny Sheffield. Zandra: Frances Gifford. Von Reichart: Stanley Ridges. Patriarch: Pedro de Cordoba. Bausch: Philip Van Zandt. Schmidt: Rex Williams. Sergeant: Sig Ruman. Archmet: Stanley Brown. William Thiele directed.

programme.title: Treasure Island
programme.desc: The first sound version of Robert Louis Stevenson's oft-filmed classic tale of a young English lad, a one-legged pirate named Long John Silver and a quest for buried treasure.

programme.title: The Long Voyage Home
programme.desc: The lives of the crew who live aboard the freighter Glencairn are followed as they drink, womanize, fight and bond, sometimes searching for ways to cure boredom, and sometimes facing life or death situations.

programme.title: Patterns
programme.desc: A bright young man is brought into the executive pool at a top New York firm run by a ruthless CEO as a potential replacement for an ailing exec, whom the CEO is easing out in a most unsubtle fashion.

programme.title: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
programme.desc: A prospector who becomes the proprietor of a stagecoach watering stop.

programme.title: Noticias Telemundo - Mediodía
programme.desc: Un programa con un estilo único de narrar la noticias, de una manera atractiva y perspicaz. Este noticiero cuenta con la presentación de historias locales y nacionales en vivo, haciendo uso extensivo de elementos gráficos. Además, este noticiero...

programme.title: La Reina del Sur
programme.desc: Una mujer inteligente y sagaz se mete en el mundo de narcos tras la muerte de su amor.

programme.title: En casa con Telemundo
programme.desc: Una oferta ligera, de formato accesible, familiar y cálido que incluye entrevistas con grandes estrellas del espectáculo, invitados especiales, buenas noticias y consejos para una vida sana.

programme.title: La mesa caliente
programme.desc: Un equipo de mujeres audaces y empoderadas, debate sobre los temas más controversiales.

programme.title: Al rojo vivo
programme.desc: La revista noticiosa que define la agenda de la televisión en español en los Estados Unidos. Se caracteriza por ofrecer, antes que nadie, historias que cautivan al público hispano y por presentarlas en un formato innovador, que resalta el aspecto humano de cada noticia.

programme.title: En casa con Telemundo

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and Co. investigate the death of a teenager. Before long, they conclude that the teen may be connected to an orchestrated bombing scheme that could kill hundreds of people. Racing against time, the team scrambles to find the bomb.

programme.desc: This landmark adult Western centered on Marshal Matt Dillon of Dodge City. John Wayne turned down the lead, suggesting James Arness (who remained for its entire run). Its popularity spawned a number of copycats, but none would enjoy the longevity (and few the consistent quality) of this classic.
